head.title: The Court's Term Is Over, but Not the Discord

hedline.hl1: The Court's Term Is Over, but Not the Discord

abstract.p: Dr Victor G Carrion letter sees harm to self-esteem of gay adolescents from Supreme Court ruling that Boy Scouts organization may dismiss gay troop leader (S)

block.p: Re ''Supreme Court Backs Boy Scouts in Ban of Gays From Membership'' (front page, June 29):
Re ''Supreme Court Backs Boy Scouts in Ban of Gays From Membership'' (front page, June 29):

The self-esteem of gay adolescents is influenced by the not-so-subtle message that who they are is not acceptable. The court's decision perpetuates the hostile social environment in which young gay people grow. If as a society we care about the identity formation of gay youth, we must offer them the same opportunity to develop a healthy sense of themselves.

Many of these children struggle with the lack of support from their schools and their families, and many become homeless at an early age. Their last hope is to be protected by a more enlightened society.
VICTOR G. CARRION, M.D. Stanford, Calif., June 29, 2000
The writer is an assistant professor of child psychiatry and child development at Stanford University.
